body:
Y'know when you're about to go to the monument and some guy follows you, making you have a sense of suspicion and dread? 

Then you guys have an arguement over which building block to use to cover the monument... like this:


You guys argue the whole time then while you're distracted, an enemy comes and crouches behind the wood he built around himself and mines the heck out of the monument.
body_tagged:
Y'know when you're about to go to the monument and some guy follows you, making you have a sense of suspicion and dread? 

Then you guys have an arguement over which building block to use to cover the monument... like this:


You guys argue the whole time then while you're distracted, an enemy comes and crouches behind the wood he built around himself and mines the heck out of the monument.
title: Which do you chose for defense?

replies.body: Feedback is appreciated :P
replies.body_tagged: Feedback is appreciated :P

replies.body: Never cover the monument!
replies.body_tagged: Never cover the monument!

replies.body: Honestly, if I were to cover the monument, I would use a TON of glass. With wood, it's easy to sneak and mine through all the wood. But the defenses that I find hard to beat are the ones where the defender mines all the blocks around the monument, and the monument is 5-10 blocks In the air or so.
replies.body_tagged: Honestly, if I were to cover the monument, I would use a TON of glass. With wood, it's easy to sneak and mine through all the wood. But the defenses that I find hard to beat are the ones where the defender mines all the blocks around the monument, and the monument is 5-10 blocks In the air or so.

replies.body: Exactly, Yoshi.  I prefer to use glass to cover the monument so the defenders can hear if an intruder has arrived. :p
replies.body_tagged: Exactly, Yoshi.  I prefer to use glass to cover the monument so the defenders can hear if an intruder has arrived. :p

replies.body: Covering the monument in general is a no no.
replies.body_tagged: Covering the monument in general is a no no.

replies.body: Fucking kids...Cover it with wool so it looks like a tree
replies.body_tagged: Fucking kids...Cover it with wool so it looks like a tree

replies.body: By far the best defense I know is take the whole monument and leave the obsidian floating in the air. After that make a pillar directly under the obby and pillar up a couple blocks on top of the obby, finally put ladders on all 4 sides of the pillar
replies.body_tagged: By far the best defense I know is take the whole monument and leave the obsidian floating in the air. After that make a pillar directly under the obby and pillar up a couple blocks on top of the obby, finally put ladders on all 4 sides of the pillar

replies.body: IMO, Slabs on the ground, Buttons on the monument, and a big wall infront of it.
replies.body_tagged: IMO, Slabs on the ground, Buttons on the monument, and a big wall infront of it.

replies.body: I use different methods on different maps >-<
replies.body_tagged: I use different methods on different maps >-<

replies.body: always cover the monument with things like ladder and buttons
replies.body_tagged: always cover the monument with things like ladder and buttons

replies.body:
Personally, as you can see... on the right is me. So y'all already know that i chose glass. 

The reason: Glass has a loud and distinct noise. If someone attempts to mine the monument, i will hear it when it breaks and rush to it. It also helps to set pressure plates because they are basically motion detectors. If someone steps on one, I'll know ;) 

The objective of my defense is to make it as noisy as possible. 

I also encourage you guys to break your bridges when building over to a monument.
replies.body_tagged:

The objective of my defense is to make it as noisy as possible. 

I also encourage you guys to break your bridges when building over to a monument.

replies.body: compromise: you guys cover with glass, while the other team covers it with wood :P
replies.body_tagged: compromise: you guys cover with glass, while the other team covers it with wood :P

replies.body: In 1.8 you will be able to place buttons on the floor which will be really irritating.
replies.body_tagged: In 1.8 you will be able to place buttons on the floor which will be really irritating.

replies.body: Cover it in TNT.
replies.body_tagged: Cover it in TNT.

replies.body: No! Just... no..! NO! NO! NO! NO! NOOOOOO! D:
replies.body_tagged: No! Just... no..! NO! NO! NO! NO! NOOOOOO! D:

replies.body: Last I checked you can't destroy obsidian with it.

I just let the obsidian sit in the open and I wait.
Then, I get bored and this happens:

Ultimately, we usually win, miraculously.

I use tnt whenever someone covers themselves. I set TNT like crazy all over their block and blow 'em up.

replies.body:
General guide to defense! This is what will happen:

1. Start defense
2.  Team mate comes over
3. You start thinking "fml"
4. Your teammate builds some crap over your defense
5. More team mates come
6. They do the same
7. You try to stop them but it doesn't work
8. You get pissed off and decide to go on offsense
9. The other team break the monument. 


This happens to me every game. Ever wonder why I I don't defend?
